results.title: Henry IV. Part 1. (Perspective)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Shakespeare in Perspective Series”.
Designed to give a greater understanding and appreciation of the play by placing it in its historical and social context and by stressing its relevance for a modern-day audience. Perspective offered by George Melly, singer, writer and entertainer.

results.title: Henry IV. Part 1 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: BBC, Cedric Messina and David Giles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “BBC Television Shakespeare Series”.
Featuring Jon Finch as King Henry IV, David Gwillim as Prince Hal, Anthony Quayle as Falstaff. Shakespeare’s play is the dark portrait of a king who comes to the throne with blood on his hands. Having killed Richard III, he is guilt ridden by the knowledge of his foul deed. A usurper himself he is now being plotted against by those who helped him to power.

results.title: Henry Ford 1863-1947
results.brief_description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.
results.description: Deals with the history and development of Henry Ford’s industrial empire. Archival film and re-enactments show events such as the building of the early car models, their effect on society, his relations with organised labour, and the impact of the Great Depression.

results.title: Henry Ford's America
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Paul Wright, Donald Brittain, Roman Kroitor and Janet Leissner
results.brief_description: An inside look at the workings of the Ford Motor Company. Traces the history of the company using historical footage, and interviews with Henry Ford II and other company executives. Looks at the developing role of the car within American society. Script, Donald Brittain. Editing, Rosemarie Shapely and Les Halman. Images, Andreas Poulsson. Music, Art Phillips.

results.title: Henry & June
results.creator_credit: Walrus and Associates, Peter Kaufman and Philip Kaufman
results.brief_description: Based on the long-suppressed sections of Anais Nin’s diaries “Henry & June” explores the erotic life of two individuals who became 20th Century literary giants. Upon meeting unconvential American author Henry Miller (Fred Ward) in Paris, 1931, Anais Nin (Maria de Medeiros) boldly embarks on a passionate voyage of self-discovery. In their defiant search for new truths, Anais and Henry are tantalized by Henry’s enigmatic and hauntingly sensual wife, June (Uma Thurman)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Walrus and Associates, Peter Kaufman and Philip Kaufman

results.title: Henrik Ibsen
results.creator_credit: London Weekend Television and Nigel Wattis
results.brief_description: Narrated by Michael Meyer, this discussion of the controversial career of playwright, Henrik Ibsen, covers both biographical details of the writer and delineates the four significant stages in his writing through a comprehensive study of the themes and the sociological and political impact of his work and its part in changing the face of live theatre. His characteristic questioning of authority and tradition and demands for debate on issues in wider society through his work is evoked and discussed. As is the powerful turning point in theatre his approach to writing and acting influenced, with discussion of his scripts about ordinary people that turned theatre into a mirror on society and encouraged relational acting instead of grand solo performances in larger than life show pieces that had previously dominated the theatrical scene. Through the program’s commentary, interviews with other writers and academics, through readings of his work, including his letters and diaries, and excerpts from performances of his renowned plays this documentary provides a thorough analysis of the influential work of Henrik Ibsen as well as a contextual insight into the more personal life of this powerful writer.

results.title: Henri Rousseau: le douanier (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ecrans Modernes, F Tavano and Lo Duca
results.brief_description: Portrays the life of the French primitive painter, Henri Rousseau, as reflected in his paintings. The film discusses the “phenomenon of Rousseau” in the evolution of the art of painting, shows the life of his imagination and reviews his work according to its inner logic.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ecrans Modernes, F Tavano and Lo Duca
